title: List of Aberdeen and Aberdeenshire schools closed amid 'thundersnow' warning
text:
The snowfall across the north-east has hit with a renewed vigour overnight as weather warnings continue to batter Aberdeen and Aberdeenshire.
A yellow warning for snow and ice remains in place until 9pm tonight across the region with the Met Office also predicting a rare phenomenon thundersnow phenomenon to hit. This is a thunderstorm - where snow falls as the primary precipitation as opposed to rain and usually only happens around 10 times a year across the world.
The heavy snowfall, which comes as a Met Office yellow warning for snow and ice remains in place, has led to dozens of schools making the decision to shut their doors due to the treacherous conditions.

The Met Office warning reads: "Snow showers will feed inland on brisk northerly winds from late Tuesday through Wednesday and into Thursday, giving significant accumulations in places.
Whilst there will be a lot of regional variation in amounts, where showers are most frequent 2-5 cm will be possible at low levels, with 5-10 cm on hills above about 100 m elevation, and potentially as much as 15-20 cm above 300 m."
Read below to check all the latest school closures across the city and shire.
